Class Nifty

java.lang.Object
de.lessvoid.nifty.Nifty
public class Nifty extends Object

      Update Nifty.
      Returns:

      @Deprecated public void executeEndOfFrameElementActions()
      Deprecated.

    • validateXml

      public void validateXml(@Nonnull String filename) throws Exception
      Load and validate the given filename. If the file is valid, nothing happens. If it is invalid you'll get an exception explaining the error.
      Parameters:
      filename - filename to check
      Throws:
      Exception - exception describing the error

    • createImage

      Parameters:
      baseResolutionX - width, for instance 1024
      baseResolutionY - height, for instance 768

    • enableAutoScaling

      public void enableAutoScaling(int baseResolutionX, int baseResolutionY, float scaleX, float scaleY)

    • disableAutoScaling

      public void disableAutoScaling()

    • getResourceAsStream

      @Nullable public InputStream getResourceAsStream(@Nonnull String ref)
      Return an InputStream for the given resource name. This is resolved using the currently registered ResourceLocations.
      Parameters:
      ref - the name of the resource to load
      Returns:
      the InputStream of the resource data

    • getResourceLoader

      @Nonnull public NiftyResourceLoader getResourceLoader()
      Return the ResourceLoader of this Nifty instance.
      Returns:
      the ResourceLoader to load resources

    • setAbsoluteClip

      public void setAbsoluteClip(int x0, int y0, int x1, int y1)
      This method clip a rectangle area. This is meant to be used outside nifty.render(true) call, it will clip an area like a camera . Note: Some elements with childClip=true could modify this clip within nifty.render(true) loop. Tested on Java2d renderer.
      Parameters:
      x0 - X coordinates of left-upper corner
      y0 - Y coordinates of left-upper corner
      x1 - X coordinates of right-bottom corner
      y1 - Y coordinates of right-bottom corner

    • setAbsoluteClipRect

      public void setAbsoluteClipRect(int x, int y, int width, int height)
      setAbsoluteClip but this use position and size of a rectangle
      Parameters:
      x -
      y -
      width -
      height -

    • disableAbsoluteClip

      public void disableAbsoluteClip()
      Disable absolute clipping.

    • internalPopupRemoved

      public void internalPopupRemoved(String id)

    • setNiftyMethodInvokerDebugEnabled

      public void setNiftyMethodInvokerDebugEnabled(boolean debugEnabled)
      Set this to true to let the NiftyMethodInvoker not catch RuntimeException/Exception when calling any interact on click method. This way when your on click handler crashes with an Exception it will crash the whole application. This might be helpful when you develop your application. The default value is false which will not crash the application but instead will only log the exception.
      Parameters:
      debugEnabled - set to true to not catch exceptions (default value is false)

    • isNiftyMethodInvokerDebugEnabled

      public boolean isNiftyMethodInvokerDebugEnabled()

    • setDefaultInputMappingType

      public static void setDefaultInputMappingType(@Nonnull Class<? extends NiftyInputMapping> defaultInputMappingType)
      Sets the static default NiftyInputMapping used by all input event handlers. Important note: this change will persist to all Nifty instances.
